STYLE.NAME: Blonde Ale
STYLE.NOTES: All malt, dry, crisp beer approximating a lager in overall character. Enjoying a resurgence at may microbreweries as an alternative to American style lagers.
STYLE.PROFILE: Dry, light to medium body with light malty sweetness. Low to medium hop bitterness with minimal aroma. Slight fruit flavor. Light yellow to golden blonde color with no chill haze. Med to high carbonation.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Generally all malt. Sometimes uses up to 25% wheat or sugar adjuncts. Low hop rate. American, light English or Kolsch yeast. Some have honey, spices or fruit added.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Goose Island Blonde Ale, Redhook Blonde, Sea Dog Windjammer Blonde, Catamount Gold, Hollywood Blonde, Pete's Wicked Summer Brew
